tag.name: cfinput
tag.help: Used within the cfform tag, to place radio buttons, check boxes, or text boxes on a form. Provides input validation for the specified control type.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: text: creates a text entry box control radio: creates a radio button control checkbox: creates a check box control password: creates a password entry control

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: Stylesheet class for form input element.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: date: verifies format mm/dd/yy. eurodate: verifies date format dd/mm/yyyy. time: verifies time format hh:mm:ss. float: verifies floating point format. integer: verifies integer format. telephone: verifies telephone format ###-###-####. The separator can be a blank. Area code and exchange must begin with digit 1 - 9. zipcode: verifies, in U.S. formats only, 5- or 9-digit format #####-####. The separator can be a blank. creditcard: strips blanks and dashes; verifies number using mod10 algorithm. Number must have 13-16 digits. social_security_number: verifies format ###-##-####. The separator can be a blank. regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to display if validation fails

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Minimum and maximum value range, separated by a comma. If type = "text" or "password", this applies only to numeric data.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of text entered, if type=text or password.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify regex in the validate attribute. Omit leading and trailing slashes.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object values are passed to the routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, and False otherwise. If used, the validate attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Size of input control. Ignored, if type=radio or checkbox.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Initial value for form input element.

parameter.name: checked
parameter.help: Selects a control. No value is required. Applies if type=radio or checkbox. Default: false

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help:
Passes one or more arbitrary attribute-value pairs to the HTML code that is generated for the tag. You can use either of the following formats to include the quotation marks around the attribute value:
passthrough="ID=""myID""" passthrough='ID="myID"'
The second format, which surrounds all the attribute-value pairs to be passed through in single quotation marks is clearer, particularly when you pass multiple HTML attributes.
